isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - REASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: If previously removed, install the corresponding snap rings in the I.D. of the mainshaft gears.
Secure the mainshaft in a vise equipped with brass jaws or wood blocks, pilot end of the shaft down ( Figure 347). If previously removed, install the roll pin in the keyway.

figure.caption: Figure 346. Install Roll Pin in Keyway

step1.para: Install the 3rd speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of washer up. Rotate washer in the 1st or bottom groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft ( Figure 348). Install the key in the mainshaft keyway to lock washer in place.

figure.caption: Figure 347. Install and Rotate 3rd Speed Gear Limit Washer

step1.para: Install the spacer on the shaft against the washer ( Figure 349).

figure.caption: Figure 348. Install Spacer on Shaft

step1.para: Install the 3rd speed (or overdrive) gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down and engaged with the external splines of the spacer ( Figure 350).

figure.caption: Figure 349. Install 3rd Speed Gear on Mainshaft

note.para: Gear limit washers are internally splined and locked to mainshaft by the key. Gear spacers are externally splined to engage with clutching teeth in gear hubs. There is one limit washer and one spacer for each gear in the mainshaft assembly.

para.title: Setting Correct Axial Clearances for Mainshaft Gears

svcproc.para: Axial Clearance (End-Play) Limits Are: .005 - .012 inch for all mainshaft gears.
Washers are used to obtain the correct limits; six thicknesses are available as follows:

note.para: New style limit washers come in a full range of tolerances as corresponding colors listed above "+ red." (Example: "Orange plus red" limit washer has an inch limit thickness of .258-.260.)

svcproc.para: Always use the .248-.250 tolerance washer (White or White plus red) in the 1st and 3rd speed gear positions as shown in Figure 351.

figure.caption: Figure 350. Always Use .248-.250 Tolerance Washer in 1st and 3rd Speed Gear Positions

step1.para: Install the 2nd speed gear on the shaft against the 3rd speed gear, clutching teeth up ( Figure 352).

figure.caption: Figure 351. Install 2nd Speed Gear on Shaft

step1.para: Install the spacer in 2nd speed gear, engaging the external splines of the spacer with the clutching teeth of the gear ( Figure 353).

figure.caption: Figure 352. Install Spacer in 2nd Speed Gear

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the 2nd speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer down and against the spacer. Rotate the washer in the 2nd groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and re-insert key in the keyway to lock the washer in place ( inset, Figure 354).

figure.caption: Figure 353. Install and Rotate 2nd Speed Gear Limit Washer, and Re-insert Key in Keyway

step1.para: Insert two large screwdrivers between the 2nd and 3rd speed (or ive) gears to check axial clearances ( Figure 355). Apply slight downward pressure on screwdriver handles to spread gears evenly. Making sure the gear hubs are parallel, insert a feeler gauge between the hubs. Correct axial clearance should be from .005 to .012 inch. If the clearance is less than the minimum .005 inch tolerance, the limit washer in the 2nd speed gear should be replaced by a thinner limit washer. This will increase the axial clearance between the gears. If the clearance checked is greater than the maximum .012 inch tolerance, a thicker limit washer should be installed in the 2nd speed gear. This would decrease the axial clearance between the gears.

figure.caption: Figure 354. Check Axial Clearances

step1.para: Install the 1st-2nd speed sliding clutch, aligning the missing internal spline of the sliding clutch with the key in the mainshaft ( Figure 356).

figure.caption: Figure 355. Install 1st-2nd Speed Sliding Clutch

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the 1st speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer up. Rotate washer in the 2nd groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and re-insert key in the keyway to lock the washer in place ( Figure 357).

figure.caption: Figure 356. Re-insert Key in Keyway

step1.para: Install the spacer on the shaft against the washer ( Figure 358).

figure.caption: Figure 357. Install Spacer on Shaft

step1.para: Install the 1st speed gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down and engaged with the external splines of the spacer ( Figure 359).

figure.caption: Figure 358. Install 1st Speed Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the LO speed gear on the shaft against the 1st speed gear, clutching teeth up ( Figure 360).

figure.caption: Figure 359. Install LO Speed Gear on Shaft

step1.para: Install the spacer in LO speed gear, engaging the external splines of the spacer with the clutching teeth of the gear ( Figure 361).

figure.caption: Figure 360. Install Spacer in LO Speed Gear

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the LO speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer down and against the spacer. Rotate the washer in the 4th groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and re-insert the key in the keyway to lock washer in place ( inset, Figure 362).

figure.caption: Figure 361. Install and Rotate LO Speed Gear Limit Washer, and Re-insert Key in Keyway

step1.para: Check axial clearances and make adjustments, if necessary, between the LO and 1st speed gears as described in step 9 of this section ( Figure 363).

figure.caption: Figure 362. Check Axial Clearances

step1.para: Install the LO-Reverse speed sliding clutch, aligning the missing internal spline of sliding clutch with the key in the mainshaft ( Figure 364).

figure.caption: Figure 363. Install LO-Reverse Speed Sliding Clutch

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the reverse gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer up. Rotate the washer in the 5th groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and re-insert key in keyway to lock washer in place ( Figure 365).

figure.caption: Figure 364. Install and Rotate Reverse Gear Limit Washer, and Re-insert Key in Keyway

step1.para: Install the spacer on the shaft against the washer ( Figure 366).

figure.caption: Figure 365. Install Spacer on Shaft

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the 6th groove of the mainshaft to retain key in the keyway ( Figure 367).

figure.caption: Figure 366. Install Snap Ring in 6th Groove of Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the hub of the reverse gear ONLY TO CHECK AXIAL CLEARANCE (END PLAY) LIMITS ( Figure 368).

figure.caption: Figure 367. Install Snap Ring in Hub of Reverse Gear to Check Axial Clearance

step1.para: Install the reverse gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down and engaged with the external splines of the spacer ( Figure 369).

figure.caption: Figure 368. Install Reverse Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the auxiliary drive gear assembly in its proper position on the rear of the mainshaft ( Figure 370).

figure.caption: Figure 369. Install Auxiliary Drive Gear Assembly

step1.para: Force both the reverse gear and auxiliary drive gear downward on the shaft to flatten their respective snap rings ( Figure 371). Making sure the gear hubs are parallel, insert a feeler gauge between the hubs of the reverse gear and auxiliary drive gear. Correct axial clearance should be from .005 inch to .012 inch. If clearance is less than the minimum .005 inch tolerance, the reverse gear limit washer should be replaced by a thinner limit washer. This will increase the axial clearance between the gears. If the clearance checked is greater than the maximum .012 inch tolerance, a thicker limit washer should be installed in the reverse gear. This would decrease the axial clearance between the gears.

figure.caption: Figure 370. Force Both Reverse Gear and Auxiliary Drive Gear Downward

note.para: This check is made without spreading the gears with screwdrivers.

step1.para: With the proper reverse gear limit washer installed on the mainshaft, remove the auxiliary drive gear assembly and reverse gear ( Figure 372).

figure.caption: Figure 371. Remove Auxiliary Drive Gear Assembly and Reverse Gear

step1.para: Remove the snap ring from the hub of the reverse gear and re-install the gear on the mainshaft ( Figure 373). Engage the clutching teeth of the gear with the splines of the spacer and sliding clutch and move the reverse gear against the LO speed gear.

figure.caption: Figure 372. Remove Snap Ring From Hub of Reverse Gear

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft assembly from the e. Align the missing internal spline of the 3rd-4th speed sliding clutch with the key in the mainshaft and install on the front of the shaft, engaging the external splines of the sliding clutch with the clutching teeth of the 3rd speed (or overdrive) gear ( Figure 374).

figure.caption: Figure 373. Install 3rd-4th Speed Sliding Clutch
